description: A disease that occurs when your blood glucose, also called blood sugar, is too high.
A condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.
A condition in which a person's airways become inflamed, narrow and swell, and produce extra mucus, which makes it difficult to breathe.
A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
A viral infection of your nose and throat (upper respiratory tract).
A skin condition that occurs when your hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells.
A mental health disorder characterized by persistently depressed mood or loss of interest in activities.
A mental health disorder characterized by feelings of worry, anxiety, or fear that are strong enough to interfere with one's daily activities.
A type of headache characterized by recurrent headaches that are moderate to severe.
A condition in which the immune system reacts abnormally to a foreign substance.
